snippet: The South American soccer confederation said it had cut ties with a controversial company, Datisa, that held marketing rights to the tournament.
abstract: Soccer Roundup; 2016 Copa America Centenario tournament, fraught with questions about its links to FIFA corruption scandal, may be held in United States after all; ties with Datisa, marketing company suspected of some impropriety, appear to have been severed.
lead_paragraph: The South American soccer confederation said it had cut ties with a controversial company, Datisa, that held marketing rights to the tournament.

headline.print_headline: Chances Improve for U.S. to Host the Copa América
headline.main: Move May Eliminate Stumbling Block to Hosting 2016 Copa América in U.S.
